text: Dita Von Teese, a prominent Burlesque performer A vixen is usually a stereotype of women as mysterious, racy, salacious, and seductive. It is used as an archetype and stock character in literature and art.1749, Henry Fielding, The History of Tom Jones, a Foundling. In Six Volumes, volume (please specify |volume=I to VI), London: Printed by A[ndrew] Millar, […], OCLC 9281842921859:, George Eliot. Adam Bede: page 54. Köln: Könemann Verlagsgesellschaft mbH, 1999 Vixens are commonly identified with dark hair and makeup, their sex appeal, and seductress personas.http://www.nikkietutorials.com/site/2014/11/vampy-vixen-fall-makeup- tutorial/ ==References== Category:Female stock characters Category:Slang terms for women Category:Stereotypes of women Category:Cultural depictions of women
